It's not masculinity in itself that can be toxic.  Behavior that is disrespectful and or abusive to another person's safety of mind or body is what is toxic.  There are emotionally abusive,  manipulative, narcissistic men & women. However, that kind of "rough" behavior is subconsciously and socially encouraged in men more then women. Besides, evolution has hard wired women to love the perceived strength and virility of our male counterparts. But lets not kid ourselves and say that there are no improvements that can be made im our social contructs. this is not an attack on men itself but I guess people  like these trigger phrases like "toxic masculinity" Etc.

@enough_is_enough.4.us I am a woman and with that said I agree with you a lot of women get sexually harassed including cat calls, whistles, inappropriate gestures, creepy stairs, and in some cases inappropriate Taps on their bottom as they walk by. I will also agree with the fact that not all women want or like that. But, let me bring this idea to the table if a woman is walking around professionally dressed ... what would you assume she would want others to think about her when they see her? Now on the other hand, if you see a woman walking down the street in stiletto heels, fishnet stockings or pantyhose, a mini skirt, and a very low cut and revealing shirt ... what would you be drawn to assume that she wants people to think or say to her? I say this because it is a very valid point. Women who dress like mentioned in the second option typically dress that way because they have low self-esteem and are seeking not only validation from others but also attention from either the opposite sex if they are straight or the same sex if they are gay and some from both sexes because they are bi sexual. Some women do this consciously While others do this subconsciously because both emotionally and mentally they are seeking out away to fill a void within their self. Now these same women and we'll use those that do this consciously for this example decide to dress that way to seek attention and when they get it they either act as if they do not enjoy it when they do or they show disgust because the ones that give them that attention do not fit and their own imagined status quo or more plainly put those that give the attention to them or not🔥 hot enough.
